alert.note: Alert for Eastern Uinta Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 1:46PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Daggett County through 215 PM MDT... At 145 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles southeast of Manila, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 35 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Daggett County. This includes U.S. Highway 191 in Utah between mile markers 376 and 392. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
